main event: A high-speed unidentified object was sighted over Verona, Italy on July 18, 1952.
interesting points: The object was circular in shape, very bright white in color, and had a bluish-white tail that was about 5 times longer than the main body.
The tail blended orange and red in color.
The object was observed for about 5 seconds before disappearing from sight.
In addition to the initial observer (a Colonel), at least 2 dependent children and several NCO personnel in the same locale observed the phenomenon and generally agreed with the description.
A US Army Major on TDY in Livorno, Italy also reported sighting the same object around the same time.
sighted object: a high-speed, circular, bright white object with a long, colored tail
witnesses: a Colonel, at least 2 dependent children, several NCO personnel, and a US Army Major
